inclusion.criterion: Adult patients 18 years and older with histologically proven locally advanced stage III or IV unresectable Squamous cell head and neck cancer SCCHN (including cancers of oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx and hypopharynx) with no evidence of distant metastasis
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine, not Squamous cell head and neck cancer

inclusion.criterion: A careful evaluation for resection is required from the surgeon and criteria for unresectability carefully defined for individual primary sites as follows:
inclusion.label: unknown
met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention, but no mention of ECOG performance status

inclusion.criterion: Adequate organ function (All labs should be obtained within 14 days prior to start of study drug treatment)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient who have had prior treatment for head and neck cancer
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: Patient has received radiation therapy, but no mention of prior treatment for head and neck cancer

exclusion.criterion: Prior history of radiation to head and neck area
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of radiation therapy to the T-L spine

notes: Patient's cancer is not Squamous cell head and neck cancer, but rather anaplastic astrocytoma. Prior radiation therapy may be a concern for eligibility.
